00019 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00020 #include "Lgm/Lgm_Octree.h"
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 #include <gsl/gsl_matrix.h>
00023 #include <gsl/gsl_linalg.h>
00024 /*
00025  * 3D basis funcs (order = 1   i.e. linear)
00026  * There are only 4 basis funcs: 1, x, y, z
00027  */
00028 void DFI_BasisFuncLin( double *b, Lgm_Vector *P ) {
00029     b[0] = 1.0; b[1] = P->x; b[2] = P->y; b[3] = P->z;
00030     return;
00031 }
00032 void DFI_FuncLin( Lgm_Vector *P, gsl_vector *C, Lgm_Vector *V ){
00033     int         i;
00034     double      b[4];
00035     DFI_BasisFuncLin( b, P );
00036     V->x = V->y = V->z = 0.0;
00037     for (i=0;  i<4; i++) V->x += b[i  ]*C->data[i];
00038     for (i=4;  i<8; i++) V->y += b[i-4]*C->data[i];
00039     for (i=8; i<12; i++) V->z += b[i-8]*C->data[i];
00040     return;
00041 }
00042 void DFI_DivBasisFuncLin( double *bdiv, Lgm_Vector *P ) {
00043     bdiv[0] = 0.0; bdiv[1] = 1.0; bdiv[2] = 0.0; bdiv[3] = 0.0; 
00044     bdiv[4] = 0.0; bdiv[5] = 0.0; bdiv[6] = 1.0; bdiv[7] = 0.0; 
00045     bdiv[8] = 0.0; bdiv[9] = 0.0; bdiv[10] = 0.0; bdiv[11] = 1.0; 
00046     return;
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052 /*
00053  *  3D basis funcs (order = 2   i.e. quadratic)
00054  *  There are 10 basis funcs: 1, x, y, z, x^2, y^2, z^2, xy, yz, xz
00055  *  Using this one may require: (1) data that isnt noisy, (2) lots of extra
00056  *  points (e.g. more than just ~10).
00057  */
00058 void DFI_BasisFunc( double *b, Lgm_Vector *P ) {
00059     b[0] = 1.0; b[1] = P->x; b[2] = P->y; b[3] = P->z;
00060     b[4] = P->x*P->x; b[5] = P->y*P->y; b[6] = P->z*P->z;
00061     b[7] = P->x*P->y; b[8] = P->y*P->z; b[9] = P->x*P->z;
00062     return;
00063 }
00064 
00065 void DFI_Func( Lgm_Vector *P, gsl_vector *C, Lgm_Vector *V ){
00066     int         i;
00067     double      b[10];
00068     DFI_BasisFunc( b, P );
00069     V->x = V->y = V->z = 0.0;
00070     for (i=0;  i<10; i++) V->x += b[i   ]*C->data[i];
00071     for (i=10; i<20; i++) V->y += b[i-10]*C->data[i];
00072     for (i=20; i<30; i++) V->z += b[i-20]*C->data[i];
00073     return;
00074 }
00075 
00076 /*
00077  * Components needed for divergence of basis functions.
00078  */
00079 void DFI_DivBasisFunc( double *bdiv, Lgm_Vector *P ) {
00080     bdiv[0] = 0.0; bdiv[1] = 1.0; bdiv[2] = 0.0;
00081     bdiv[3] = 0.0; bdiv[4] = 2.0*P->x; bdiv[5] = 0.0;
00082     bdiv[6] = 0.0; bdiv[7] = P->y; bdiv[8] = 0.0; bdiv[9] = P->z;
00083     bdiv[10] = 0.0; bdiv[11] = 0.0; bdiv[12] = 1.0;
00084     bdiv[13] = 0.0; bdiv[14] = 0.0; bdiv[15] = 2.0*P->y;
00085     bdiv[16] = 0.0; bdiv[17] = P->x; bdiv[18] = P->z; bdiv[19] = 0.0;
00086     bdiv[20] = 0.0; bdiv[21] = 0.0; bdiv[22] = 0.0;
00087     bdiv[23] = 1.0; bdiv[24] = 0.0; bdiv[25] = 0.0;
00088     bdiv[26] = 2.0*P->z; bdiv[27] = 0.0; bdiv[28] = P->y; bdiv[29] = P->x;
00089     return;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 int Lgm_DivFreeInterp( Lgm_Vector *q, Lgm_OctreeData *kNN, int K, Lgm_Vector *v ) {
00094 
00095     int             N, M, MB, rows, i, j, k;
00096     double          *B, *Phi, *W, b[10], bdiv[30], eps;
00097     gsl_matrix      *A;
00098     gsl_vector      *C, *Phi2, *tau;
00099 double xx, yy, zz, Dist2;
00100 
00101 //printf("K = %d\n", K);
00102 //printf("q = %g %g %g\n", q->x, q->y, q->z);
00103 
00104     if ( K < 8 ) return( -1 ); // under-determined system
00105 
00106 
00107 
00108     N   = K;    // # of data points (each is a 3D vector)
00109     MB  = 10;   // # of basis functions 
00110     M   = 3*MB; // there is a set of basis funcs for each dimension
00111     eps = 0.0025; // param in weight function (W = 1/(d^2 + eps) )
00112 
00113 
00114     /*
00115      * We have a system of equations such that:
00116      *      B W c = W Phi
00117      * B is:
00118      *           [  b(p1)   0     0   ]
00119      *           [  0     b(p1)   0   ]
00120      *           [  0       0   b(p1) ]
00121      *       B = [          ...       ]  (4*N+1 (row) x M (col) matrix )
00122      *           [  b(pN)   0     0   ]
00123      *           [  0     b(pN)   0   ]
00124      *           [  0       0   b(pN) ]
00125      *
00126      *        W = Diag( w1,w2, ..., wN)  (4*Nx4*N diag matrix)
00127      *  
00128      *              [ ux( p1 ) ]
00129      *              [ uy( p1 ) ]
00130      *              [ uz( p1 ) ]
00131      *              [ ux( p2 ) ]
00132      *              [ uy( p2 ) ]   (M x 1 matrix)
00133      *       Phi =  [ uz( p2 ) ]
00134      *              [    .     ]
00135      *              [ ux( pN ) ]
00136      *              [ uy( pN ) ]
00137      *              [ uz( pN ) ]
00138      *  
00139      *  
00140      *              [ cx1 ]
00141      *              [ cx2 ]
00142      *              [  .  ]
00143      *              [ cxN ]
00144      *              [ cy1 ]
00145      *              [ cy2 ]
00146      *       c =    [  .  ]   (M x 1 matrix)
00147      *              [ cyN ]
00148      *              [ cz1 ]
00149      *              [ cz2 ]
00150      *              [  .  ]
00151      *              [ czN ]
00152      *  
00153      *  To solve for c, use normal equations: B^T W^2 B c = B^T W Phi
00154      *  And solve for c using QR method.
00155      *  
00156      */
00157 
00158     /*
00159      * Set up B matrix (I guess we are absorbing W into it here)
00160      */
00161     B = (double *)calloc( (4*N+1)*M, sizeof(double) );
00162     Phi = (double *) calloc( 4*N+1, sizeof( double ) );
00163     W   = (double *) calloc( N, sizeof( double ) );
00164     for ( rows=0,i=0; i<N; i++ ){
00165         DFI_BasisFunc( b, &kNN[i].Position );
00166 xx = kNN[i].Position.x-q->x;
00167 yy = kNN[i].Position.y-q->y;
00168 zz = kNN[i].Position.z-q->z;
00169 Dist2 = xx*xx +yy*yy + zz*zz;
00170         W[i] = 1.0/( Dist2*Dist2 + eps );
00171 //printf("kNN: x, y, z, dist2, W =  %g %g %g %g %g %g %g %g\n", kNN[i].Position.x, kNN[i].Position.y, kNN[i].Position.z, kNN[i].Dist2, W[i], kNN[i].B.x, kNN[i].B.y, kNN[i].B.z);
00172 
00173         // X-comp
00174         for (j=0;j<10;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j];
00175         for (j=10;j<30;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00176         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.x;
00177 
00178         // Y-comp
00179         for (j=0; j<10;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00180         for (j=10;j<20;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j-10];
00181         for (j=20;j<30;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00182         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.y;
00183 
00184         // Z-comp
00185         for (j=0; j<20;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00186         for (j=20;j<30;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j-20];
00187         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.z;
00188 
00189         // Div = 0 constraint
00190 //        DFI_DivBasisFunc( bdiv, &kNN[i].Position );
00191 //        for (j=0;j<30;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*bdiv[j];
00192 //        Phi[rows++] = 0.0;
00193     }
00194 
00195     // Div = 0 constraint at the query point
00196 //    DFI_DivBasisFunc( bdiv, q );
00197 //    for (j=0;j<30;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = bdiv[j]/eps;
00198 //    Phi[rows++] = 0.0;
00199 
00200 
00201 //for (i=0; i<rows; i++){
00202 //  for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00203 //    printf(" %10g", *(B+  i*M + j ) );
00204 //  }
00205 //  printf("\n");
00206 //}
00207 
00208 
00209 
00210 
00211 
00212 //printf("rows = %d\n", rows);
00213 //printf("(4*N+1)*M = %d\n", (4*N+1)*M);
00214 //printf("4*N+1 = %d\n", 4*N+1);
00215 //
00216 //for (k=0; k<rows; k++) {
00217 //    printf("Phi = %g\n", Phi[k]);
00218 //}
00219 
00220     /*
00221      * Compute B^T B  (=A) and its Cholesky decomposition
00222      */
00223     A = gsl_matrix_calloc( M, M );
00224     for (i=0; i<M; i++){
00225     for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00226         A->data[ i*M + j ] = 0.0;
00227             for (k=0; k<rows; k++) A->data[ i*M + j ] += (*(B + k*M + i) * *(B + k*M + j));
00228         }
00229     }
00230 
00231 //for (i=0; i<M; i++){
00232 //  for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00233 //    printf(" %10g", A->data[ i*M + j] );
00234 //  }
00235 //  printf("\n");
00236 //}
00237 //  printf("\n");
00238 
00239     tau = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00240     gsl_linalg_QR_decomp( A, tau );
00241 
00242 //    printf(" gsl_linalg_cholesky_decomp = %d\n", gsl_linalg_cholesky_decomp( A ));
00243 //    printf(" GSL_EDO. = %d\n", GSL_EDOM);
00244 
00245 //for (i=0; i<M; i++){
00246 //  for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00247 //    printf(" %10g", A->data[ i*M + j] );
00248 //  }
00249 //  printf("\n");
00250 //}
00251 //  printf("\n");
00252 
00253     /*
00254      * Compute B^T Phi
00255      */
00256     Phi2 = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00257     for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00258         Phi2->data[ j ] = 0.0;
00259         for (k=0; k<rows; k++) Phi2->data[ j ] += *(B + k*M + j) * Phi[k];
00260 //printf("Phi2->data[%d] = %g\n", j, Phi2->data[j]);
00261     }
00262 
00263     /*
00264      *  Solve for C
00265      */
00266     C = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00267     gsl_linalg_QR_solve( A, tau, Phi2, C );
00268 //    gsl_linalg_cholesky_solve( A, Phi2, C );
00269 
00270 
00271 //for (i=0; i<M; i++){
00272 //printf("C->data[i] = %g\n", C->data[i]);
00273 //}
00274     /*
00275      * Compute vector value for the query point using the function defined by C
00276      */
00277     DFI_Func( q, C, v );
00278 
00279 
00280     free( B );
00281     gsl_vector_free( C );
00282     gsl_vector_free( Phi2 );
00283     gsl_vector_free( tau );
00284     gsl_matrix_free( A );
00285     free( Phi );
00286     free( W );
00287 
00288     return( 1 );
00289     
00290 }
00291

00293 
00294 int Lgm_DivFreeInterp2( Lgm_Vector *q, Lgm_OctreeData *kNN, int K, Lgm_Vector *v ) {
00295 
00296     int             N, M, MB, rows, i, j, k;
00297     double          *B, *Phi, *W, b[4], bdiv[12], eps;
00298     gsl_matrix      *A;
00299     gsl_vector      *C, *Phi2, *tau, *resid;
00300 double xx, yy, zz, Dist2;
00301 
00302 
00303     if ( K < 8 ) return( -1 ); // under-determined system
00304 
00305 
00306 
00307     N   = K;    // # of data points (each is a 3D vector)
00308     MB  = 4;   // # of basis functions 
00309     M   = 3*MB; // there is a set of basis funcs for each dimension
00310     eps = 0.00025; // param in weight function (W = 1/(d^2 + eps) )
00311 
00312 
00313 
00314     /*
00315      * Set up B matrix (I guess we are absorbing W into it here)
00316      */ 
00317     B = (double *)calloc( (4*N+1)*M, sizeof(double) );
00318     Phi = (double *) calloc( 4*N+1, sizeof( double ) );
00319     W   = (double *) calloc( N, sizeof( double ) );
00320     for ( rows=0,i=0; i<N; i++ ){
00321         DFI_BasisFuncLin( b, &kNN[i].Position );
00322 xx = kNN[i].Position.x-q->x;
00323 yy = kNN[i].Position.y-q->y;
00324 zz = kNN[i].Position.z-q->z;
00325 Dist2 = xx*xx +yy*yy + zz*zz;
00326         //W[i] = 1.0/( kNN[i].Dist2*kNN[i].Dist2 + eps );
00327         W[i] = 1.0/( Dist2*Dist2 + eps );
00328         //W[i] = 1.0/( kNN[i].Dist2 + eps );
00329 
00330         // X-comp
00331         for (j=0;j<4;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j];
00332         for (j=4;j<12;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00333         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.x;
00334 
00335         // Y-comp
00336         for (j=0; j<4;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00337         for (j=4;j<8;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j-4];
00338         for (j=8;j<12;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00339         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.y;
00340 
00341         // Z-comp
00342         for (j=0; j<8;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = 0.0;
00343         for (j=8;j<12;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*b[j-8];
00344         Phi[rows++] = W[i]*kNN[i].B.z;
00345 
00346         // Div = 0 constraint
00347         DFI_DivBasisFuncLin( bdiv, &kNN[i].Position );
00348         for (j=0;j<12;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = W[i]*bdiv[j];
00349         Phi[rows++] = 0.0;
00350     }
00351 
00352     // Div = 0 constraint at the query point
00353     DFI_DivBasisFuncLin( bdiv, q );
00354     for (j=0;j<12;j++) *(B + rows*M + j) = bdiv[j]/eps;
00355     Phi[rows++] = 0.0;
00356 
00357     /*
00358      * Compute B^T B  (=A) and its Cholesky decomposition
00359      */
00360     A = gsl_matrix_calloc( M, M );
00361     for (i=0; i<M; i++){
00362     for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00363         A->data[ i*M + j ] = 0.0;
00364             //for (k=0; k<rows; k++) A->data[ i*M + j ] += (*(B + k*M + i) * *(B + k*M + j));
00365             for (k=0; k<rows; k++) A->data[ i*M + j ] += (*(B + k*M + i) * *(B + k*M + j));
00366         }
00367     }
00368 
00369     tau = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00370     gsl_linalg_QR_decomp( A, tau );
00371 
00372 //gsl_linalg_cholesky_decomp( A );
00373 //    printf(" gsl_linalg_cholesky_decomp = %d\n", gsl_linalg_cholesky_decomp( A ));
00374 //    printf(" GSL_EDO. = %d\n", GSL_EDOM);
00375 
00376     /*
00377      * Compute B^T Phi
00378      */
00379     Phi2 = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00380     for (j=0; j<M; j++){
00381         Phi2->data[ j ] = 0.0;
00382         for (k=0; k<rows; k++) Phi2->data[ j ] += *(B + k*M + j) * Phi[k];
00383     }
00384 
00385     /*
00386      *  Solve for C
00387      */
00388     C = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00389 resid = gsl_vector_alloc( M );
00390     gsl_linalg_QR_lssolve( A, tau, Phi2, C, resid );
00391 //  gsl_linalg_cholesky_solve( A, Phi2, C );
00392 
00393 
00394     /*
00395      * Compute vector value for the query point using the function defined by C
00396      */
00397     DFI_FuncLin( q, C, v );
00398 
00399 
00400     free( B );
00401     gsl_vector_free( C );
00402     gsl_vector_free( Phi2 );
00403     gsl_vector_free( tau );
00404 gsl_vector_free(resid);
00405     gsl_matrix_free( A );
00406     free( Phi );
00407     free( W );
00408 
00409     return( 1 );
00410     
00411 }
00412 
00413 
00414 
00415 
00416 
00417 /*
00418  * This routine takes a point and returns the magnetic field there. The
00419  * magnetic field is computed by interpolating from a large set of scattered
00420  * pre-defined data points. In principle, this is a trivial task, but the
00421  * obvious brute force method ends up being phenomenally slow if the dataset is
00422  * large. The main problem boils down to efficiently finding the required
00423  * number of nearest neighbors that we need to do the interpolation.
00424  * Classically, this problem is referred to as the "k Nearest Neighbor Problem"
00425  * (or the "kNN Problem"). Here we use an octree-based algorithm to radically
00426  * accelerate the search for nearest neighbors.
00427  *
00428  * We also use a novel interpolation scheme that attempts to enforce divB=0.
00429  *
00430  *  There is an insidious problem with using this approach on certain types of meshes!
00431  *
00432  *  For example, when using an Euler potential mesh, what happens is that
00433  *  for query points that are far from the earth, the field lines diverge apart.
00434  *  This leads to a situation where all the NNs we get, come from the same (or
00435  *  nearly the same) meridian. This means our "interpolation" actually turns into
00436  *  a very bad extrapolation! 
00437  *
00438  *  Some possible fixes:
00439  *      1) Try to fill in more points as a pre-processing step.
00440  *      2) Try to generate a better distribution of points to
00441  *             interpolate with. E.g., we could find some number of
00442  *         NNs at the real query point. Then also some additional ones 
00443  *         at other meridians.
00444  *  
00445  *      Lets try 2) here...
00446  *
00447  */
00448 int Lgm_B_FromScatteredData( Lgm_Vector *v, Lgm_Vector *B, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00449 
00450     int             k, Flag;
00451     Lgm_Vector      P, P_m, P_p, v_m, v_p, vsm, v_m_gsm, v_p_gsm, Bcdip;
00452     double          r, CosTheta, SinTheta, Phi, Phi_m, Phi_p;
00453     double      NormalizedMaxDist, MaxDist2, w, w1, w2;
00454     Lgm_OctreeData  *kNN;
00455 
00456 
00457     if ( Lgm_Magnitude(v) < 3.0 ) {
00458         Lgm_B_cdip( v, B, Info );
00459         return(1);
00460     }
00461 
00462     /*
00463      *  Make sure Octree has been initialized
00464      */
00465     if ( Info->OctreeRoot == NULL ) return( OCTREE_IS_NULL );
00466 
00467 
00468 
00469     /*
00470      *  Allocate some space for the kNNs. Actually we will generate 3*k because 
00471      *  we are going to try the +/- meridians to get a better cloud of points.
00472      */
00473     kNN = (Lgm_OctreeData *)calloc( 2+3*Info->Octree_kNN_k, sizeof( Lgm_OctreeData ) );
00474 
00475     /*
00476      *  determine the two additional points around which to find kNNs
00477      */
00478     Lgm_Convert_Coords( v, &vsm, GSM_TO_SM, Info->c );
00479     r = Lgm_Magnitude( &vsm );
00480     CosTheta = vsm.z/r;
00481     SinTheta = sqrt( 1.0 - CosTheta*CosTheta );
00482     Phi = atan2( vsm.y, vsm.x );
00483 
00484     Phi_m = Phi - 1.0*2.0*M_PI/61.0; // hard-wired based on Sorin's mesh files -- he has 61 beta values or "meridians"
00485     v_m.x = r*SinTheta*cos( Phi_m );
00486     v_m.y = r*SinTheta*sin( Phi_m );
00487     v_m.z = r*CosTheta;
00488 
00489     Phi_p = Phi + 1.0*2.0*M_PI/61.0; // hard-wired based on Sorin's mesh files -- he has 61 beta values or "meridians"
00490     v_p.x = r*SinTheta*cos( Phi_p );
00491     v_p.y = r*SinTheta*sin( Phi_p );
00492     v_p.z = r*CosTheta;
00493 
00494     
00495 
00496 
00497 
00498 
00499     /*
00500      *  The positions in the octree have components that are all scaled to be in the range
00501      *  [0.0, 1.0]. So we need to scale our point as well.
00502      */
00503 //printf( "v = <%g %g %g>\n", v->x, v->y, v->z );
00504     P.x = (v->x - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00505     P.y = (v->y - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00506     P.z = (v->z - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00507 
00508     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &v_m, &v_m_gsm, SM_TO_GSM, Info->c );
00509     P_m.x = (v_m_gsm.x - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00510     P_m.y = (v_m_gsm.y - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00511     P_m.z = (v_m_gsm.z - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00512 
00513     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &v_p, &v_p_gsm, SM_TO_GSM, Info->c );
00514     P_p.x = (v_p_gsm.x - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00515     P_p.y = (v_p_gsm.y - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00516     P_p.z = (v_p_gsm.z - Info->OctreeScaleMin)/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00517 
00518 
00519     NormalizedMaxDist = Info->Octree_kNN_MaxDist/Info->OctreeScaleDiff;
00520     MaxDist2 = NormalizedMaxDist*NormalizedMaxDist;
00521     if (MaxDist2 > 1.0) MaxDist2 = 1.0;
00522 
00523 MaxDist2 = 1.0;
00524 
00525 
00526     /*
00527      * Given these points and the octree, find the "Octree_kNN_k" nearest neighbors.
00528      */
00529     int kgot = 0;
00530     Flag = Lgm_Octree_kNN( &P, Info->OctreeRoot, Info->Octree_kNN_k, &k, MaxDist2, kNN );
00531 //printf("P = %g, %g %g   Flag = %d\n", P.x, P.y, P.z, Flag);
00532 //    if ( Flag != OCTREE_KNN_SUCCESS ) return( Flag );
00533     kgot += k;
00534 
00535     Flag = Lgm_Octree_kNN( &P_m, Info->OctreeRoot, Info->Octree_kNN_k, &k, MaxDist2, kNN+kgot );
00536 //printf("P_m = %g, %g %g   Flag = %d\n", P_m.x, P_m.y, P_m.z, Flag);
00537 //printf("Flag = %d\n", Flag);
00538 //    if ( Flag != OCTREE_KNN_SUCCESS ) return( Flag );
00539     kgot += k;
00540     
00541 
00542     Flag = Lgm_Octree_kNN( &P_p, Info->OctreeRoot, Info->Octree_kNN_k, &k, MaxDist2, kNN+kgot );
00543 //printf("P_p = %g, %g %g   Flag = %d\n", P_p.x, P_p.y, P_p.z, Flag);
00544 //printf("Flag = %d\n", Flag);
00545 //    if ( Flag != OCTREE_KNN_SUCCESS ) return( Flag );
00546     kgot += k;
00547 
00548 
00549 
00550 
00551 
00552 
00553 
00554 
00555 
00556 
00557 int i;
00558 /*
00559 FILE *fpout;
00560 fpout = fopen("NN.dat", "w");
00561 sx = sy = sz = 0.0;
00562 */
00563 for (i=0; i<kgot; i++){
00564 
00565 /*
00566     v_p_gsm.x = kNN[i].Position.x*Info->OctreeScaleDiff + Info->OctreeScaleMin;
00567     v_p_gsm.y = kNN[i].Position.y*Info->OctreeScaleDiff + Info->OctreeScaleMin;
00568     v_p_gsm.z = kNN[i].Position.z*Info->OctreeScaleDiff + Info->OctreeScaleMin;
00569     fprintf(fpout, "%g %g\n", v_p_gsm.x, v_p_gsm.z);
00570 xx = P_m.x-kNN[i].Position.x;
00571 yy = P_m.y-kNN[i].Position.y;
00572 zz = P_m.z-kNN[i].Position.z;
00573 NewDist2 = xx*xx + yy*yy + zz*zz;
00574     printf("%d Dist2 = %g, kNN[%d].Position = %g %g %g   kNN[i].B[%d] = %g %g %g\n", i, kNN[i].Dist2, i, kNN[i].Position.x, kNN[i].Position.y, kNN[i].Position.z, i, kNN[i].B.x, kNN[i].B.y, kNN[i].B.z);
00575 */
00576 /*
00577     printf("%d Dist2 = %g, NewDist2 = %g kNN[%d].Position = %g %g %g   v = %g %g %g,  kNN[i].B[%d] = %g %g %g", i, kNN[i].Dist2, NewDist2, i, kNN[i].Position.x, kNN[i].Position.y, kNN[i].Position.z, v_p_gsm.x, v_p_gsm.y, v_p_gsm.z, i, kNN[i].B.x, kNN[i].B.y, kNN[i].B.z);
00578     if (v_p_gsm.z > 0.0) printf(" ****\n");
00579     else printf("\n");
00580 
00581     sx += kNN[i].B.x;
00582     sy += kNN[i].B.y;
00583     sz += kNN[i].B.z;
00584 */
00585 }
00586 /*
00587 sx /= (double)kgot;
00588 sy /= (double)kgot;
00589 sz /= (double)kgot;
00590 printf("-----------------------------------------------\n");
00591 printf("Avg = %g %g %g\n", sx, sy, sz);
00592 fclose(fpout);
00593 
00594 */
00595 
00596 
00597 double xx, yy, zz, NewDist2;
00598 xx = v->x-kNN[0].Position.x;
00599 yy = v->y-kNN[0].Position.y;
00600 zz = v->z-kNN[0].Position.z;
00601 NewDist2 = xx*xx+yy*yy+zz*zz;
00602 
00603     /*
00604      * Interpolate the points
00605      */
00606     if ( Info->Octree_kNN_InterpMethod == LINEAR_DFI ){
00607 
00608 //printf("kgot = %d\n", kgot);
00609         Lgm_DivFreeInterp2( &P, kNN, kgot, B );
00610 
00611         //if (kgot == 3*Info->Octree_kNN_k) {
00612         //    Lgm_DivFreeInterp2( &P, kNN, kgot, B );
00613         //} else if (kgot > 2*Info->Octree_kNN_k ){
00614 //        if ( NewDist2 < .25 ) {
00615 //            Lgm_DivFreeInterp2( &P, kNN, kgot, B );
00616 //        } else {//if (kgot > 2*Info->Octree_kNN_k ){
00617 // add a boundary point
00618 //kNN[kgot].Position.x = kNN[0].Position.x;
00619 //kNN[kgot].Position.y = kNN[0].Position.y;
00620 //kNN[kgot].Position.z = 10.0;
00621 //kNN[kgot].B.x = 0.0;
00622 //kNN[kgot].B.y = 0.0;
00623 //kNN[kgot].B.z = -1.0;
00624 //kgot++;
00625 /*
00626 kNN[kgot].Position.x = kNN[0].Position.x;
00627 kNN[kgot].Position.y = kNN[0].Position.y;
00628 kNN[kgot].Position.z = -10.0;
00629 kNN[kgot].B.x = 0.0;
00630 kNN[kgot].B.y = 0.0;
00631 kNN[kgot].B.z = -1.0;
00632 kgot++;
00633 */
00634 //            Lgm_DivFreeInterp2( &P, kNN, kgot, B );
00635 /*
00636             w  = (double)(3*Info->Octree_kNN_k);
00637             w1 = (double)kgot;
00638             w2 = (double)(3*Info->Octree_kNN_k - kgot);
00639             Lgm_B_cdip( v, &Bcdip, Info );
00640             B->x = (w1*B->x + w2*Bcdip.x)/w;
00641             B->y = (w1*B->y + w2*Bcdip.y)/w;
00642             B->z = (w1*B->z + w2*Bcdip.z)/w;
00643 */
00644 //        } /*else {
00645 //            Lgm_B_cdip( v, B, Info );
00646 //        }*/
00647 //printf("B = %g %g %g\n", B->x, B->y, B->z);
00648         
00649 
00650     } else if ( Info->Octree_kNN_InterpMethod == QUADRATIC_DFI ) { 
00651 
00652         Lgm_DivFreeInterp( &P, kNN, kgot, B );
00653 
00654     } else if ( Info->Octree_kNN_InterpMethod == NEWTON_INTERP ) {
00655 
00656         Lgm_Vector  f0, f1, f2, f3, A1, A2, A3;
00657         double      dx, dy, dz, dx2, dy2, dz2, D10, D12, D20, D30, D31, D32;
00658         double      dv0, dv1, dv2, dv3;
00659         
00660         f0.x = kNN[0].B.x; f0.y = kNN[0].B.y; f0.z = kNN[0].B.z;
00661         f1.x = kNN[1].B.x; f1.y = kNN[1].B.y; f1.z = kNN[1].B.z;
00662         f2.x = kNN[2].B.x; f2.y = kNN[2].B.y; f2.z = kNN[2].B.z;
00663         f3.x = kNN[3].B.x; f3.y = kNN[3].B.y; f3.z = kNN[3].B.z;
00664 
00665         dx = kNN[1].Position.x - kNN[0].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00666         dy = kNN[1].Position.y - kNN[0].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00667         dz = kNN[1].Position.z - kNN[0].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00668         D10 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00669 
00670         dx = kNN[1].Position.x - kNN[2].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00671         dy = kNN[1].Position.y - kNN[2].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00672         dz = kNN[1].Position.z - kNN[2].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00673         D12 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00674         
00675         dx = kNN[2].Position.x - kNN[0].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00676         dy = kNN[2].Position.y - kNN[0].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00677         dz = kNN[2].Position.z - kNN[0].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00678         D20 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00679         
00680         dx = kNN[3].Position.x - kNN[0].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00681         dy = kNN[3].Position.y - kNN[0].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00682         dz = kNN[3].Position.z - kNN[0].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00683         D30 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00684         
00685         dx = kNN[3].Position.x - kNN[1].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00686         dy = kNN[3].Position.y - kNN[1].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00687         dz = kNN[3].Position.z - kNN[1].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00688         D31 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00689         
00690         dx = kNN[3].Position.x - kNN[2].Position.x; dx2 = dx*dx; 
00691         dy = kNN[3].Position.y - kNN[2].Position.y; dy2 = dy*dy; 
00692         dz = kNN[3].Position.z - kNN[2].Position.z; dz2 = dz*dz;
00693         D32 = sqrt( dx2 + dy2 +dz2 );
00694 
00695         A1.x = (f1.x-f0.x)/D10; 
00696         A1.y = (f1.y-f0.y)/D10; 
00697         A1.z = (f1.z-f0.z)/D10;
00698 
00699         A2.x = ((f2.x-f0.x)/D20 + (f0.x-f1.x)/D10)/D12; 
00700         A2.y = ((f2.y-f0.y)/D20 + (f0.y-f1.y)/D10)/D12; 
00701         A2.z = ((f2.z-f0.z)/D20 + (f0.z-f1.z)/D10)/D12;
00702 
00703         A3.x = (D12*((f3.x-f0.x)/D30+(f0.x-f1.x)/D10)+D31*((f1.x-f0.x)/D10+(f0.x-f2.x)/D20))/D12/D31/D32;
00704         A3.y = (D12*((f3.y-f0.y)/D30+(f0.y-f1.y)/D10)+D31*((f1.y-f0.y)/D10+(f0.y-f2.y)/D20))/D12/D31/D32;
00705         A3.z = (D12*((f3.z-f0.z)/D30+(f0.z-f1.z)/D10)+D31*((f1.z-f0.z)/D10+(f0.z-f2.z)/D20))/D12/D31/D32;
00706 
00707         dv0 = sqrt( kNN[0].Dist2 );
00708         dv1 = sqrt( kNN[1].Dist2 );
00709         dv2 = sqrt( kNN[2].Dist2 );
00710         dv3 = sqrt( kNN[3].Dist2 );
00711 
00712         B->x = f0.x + A1.x*dv0 + A2.x*dv0*dv1 + A3.x*dv0*dv1*dv2;
00713         B->y = f0.y + A1.y*dv0 + A2.y*dv0*dv1 + A3.y*dv0*dv1*dv2;
00714         B->z = f0.z + A1.z*dv0 + A2.z*dv0*dv1 + A3.z*dv0*dv1*dv2;
00715 
00716     }
00717 
00718     free( kNN );
00719 
00720 
00721     ++Info->nFunc;
00722 
00723     return( 1 );
00724 
00725 }
